content.description: This fun route begins at the curve to the left. Follow the curve of the boulder until you can round the corner, to finally make the glorious scamper up to the top.The beta is pretty reachy, and some sketchy feet at some points. Some satisfying edging at one point as well. The crux is definitely in the middle of the curve, and ends when you manage to get your foot shoved into a jug near the corner. A balance heavy transition.
content.location: left side (when viewed from the creek/trail) of the knob.

content.description: Distinctive boulder sitting across the creek and across the trail, with a gnarled cedar on top. The interesting knob feature means that this boulder has potential for a few more fun lines.One potential project could be starting below the face of the knob - it'll be a difficult one-two moves in the beginning to lift up onto the face, but once actually on the face, the rest would be easy.Note: It's easiest to just cross the creek to get to this boulder - bring a towel to dry off your feet. Once at the top, you can down climb and jump off the face, or just go up to the trail above and walk the long way back.
